title: Larry Wallis, guitarist with the Pink Fairies and Motörhead who went on to produce classic punk hits and write songs for Dr Feelgood – obituary
text:
Larry Wallis, who has died aged 70, was a guitarist, singer and songwriter who played with the Pink Fairies and Motörhead in the early 1970s; later, during the punk revolution, he joined Stiff Records and moved behind the mixing desk, producing records by Wreckless Eric and the Adverts, as well as writing songs for Dr Feelgood.

He was born on May 19 1949, and was inspired to take up the guitar by the skiffle phenomenon. Then, he recalled: “When I heard Hank Marvin [of the Shadows] … and saw the pic of him with a Vox solid body guitar, all was truly lost.”

He formed his first band, the Saints, which became the King Bees, and worked at Selmer, the fabled musical instrument shop in Charing Cross...
